code:
# @param {String} s1
# @param {String} s2
# @return {Boolean}
def check_strings(s1, s2)
    # Separate characters located at even and odd indices for both strings
    s1_even, s1_odd, s2_even, s2_odd = '', '', '', ''
    
    s1.chars.each_with_index do |c, i|
        if i.even?
            s1_even << c
        else
            s1_odd << c
        end
    end
    
    s2.chars.each_with_index do |c, i|
        if i.even?
            s2_even << c
        else
            s2_odd << c
        end
    end
    
    # Sort the characters at even and odd indices for comparison
    s1_even, s1_odd, s2_even, s2_odd = [s1_even, s1_odd, s2_even, s2_odd].map { |str| str.chars.sort.join }
    
    # Return true if and only if the sorted sequences match for both even and odd indices
    s1_even == s2_even && s1_odd == s2_odd
end
